Legal_Issue: Did the PRRA officer err in rejecting the applicants' claim based on new evidence and state protection analysis?
Governing_Law: Section 113 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA)
Evidence_Assessment: Applicants provided new evidence but failed to meet Section 113(a) criteria
Decision_Outcome: PRRA officer concluded no substantial risk existed upon return to Mexico
Burden_of_Proof: On applicants to demonstrate new evidence meets Section 113 criteria
Legal_Rule: Section 113(a) of IRPA governs admissibility of new evidence post-rejection
Procedural_Issue: Whether the PRRA decision was reasonable
Grounds_for_Claim: New evidence and state protection analysis
Outcome_on_Merits: No substantial risk found; claim rejected
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: PRRA decision was within acceptable legal outcomes
Applicant_Challenge: Challenge to denial of PRRA based on new evidence
Court_Result: Judicial review rejected; PRRA decision upheld
Remedy_Requested: Successful judicial review setting aside PRRA decision
Remedy_Sought: Reassessment of PRRA with consideration of new evidence
Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board (PRRA officer), Federal Court
